page.title: 10BUILDING MATERIALS
page.content: During our survey of the buildings in Alderton we also considered the materials used in the building of roofs and walls. Out of the 125 buildings surveyed 110 had tiled roofs, 9 slate, 3 thatch and 3 other materials. The survey of the walls revealed that 55 buildings were built of reconstituted stone, 54 of brick, 10 were of mixed construction, 5 of natural stone and 1, the village hall of timber. The houses built of reconstituted stone are modern and this material is used as a cheaper alternative to natural stone and complies with planning regulations. the brick houses were all built before planning regulations were introduced.
